user_error_text: Failing Hard Drive / SSD detected after startup
symptoms: Slow file access, freezing, clicking noises, SMART warning on boot
cause: Drive developing bad sectors or mechanical/electronic failure
step_1: Backup important files immediately to external drive or cloud.
step_2: Run SMART check with manufacturer's tool (e.g., CrystalDiskInfo).
step_3: Run chkdsk C: /f /r and allow it to run at restart.
step_4: If SMART failing, clone the drive to new SSD/HDD or replace the drive.
step_5: Stop using failing drive and consult repair service.
verification: Hardware works normally after following steps for several restarts/use.
log_snippet: Kernel: Failing Hard Drive / SSD device reported I/O errors

user_error_text: Faulty RAM Module - clicking noise or no boot
symptoms: Random crashes, blue screens, apps crash, system instability
cause: Faulty RAM module or incorrect seating/timings
step_1: Save work and restart the PC.
step_2: Run Windows Memory Diagnostic (mdsched.exe).
step_3: Reseat RAM sticks and test one stick at a time.
step_4: Swap RAM slots to isolate bad stick.
step_5: Replace faulty RAM with compatible modules.
verification: Hardware works normally after following steps for several restarts/use.
log_snippet: Kernel: Faulty RAM Module device reported I/O errors

user_error_text: CPU Overheating / Throttling when running heavy apps/games
symptoms: PC slows down under load, sudden shutdowns, fans loud
cause: Poor cooling or failing fan
step_1: Clean vents and fans with compressed air (power off).
step_2: Monitor temps with HWMonitor while using PC lightly.
step_3: Ensure fans spin and vents are clear.
step_4: Reapply thermal paste or replace cooler if needed (desktop).
step_5: Avoid heavy workloads until cooling fixed; seek technician for laptop.
verification: Hardware works normally after following steps for several restarts/use.
log_snippet: Power: CPU Overheating / Throttling undervoltage detected

user_error_text: My PC shows 'GPU Failure / Artifacts' error and behaves strangely
symptoms: Artifacts, driver crashes, black screen
cause: Failing GPU or VRAM issues
step_1: Update/reinstall GPU driver from vendor site.
step_2: Test with different cable/monitor.
step_3: Reseat GPU and power cables (desktop).
step_4: Run short stress test (stop if artifacts appear).
step_5: Replace GPU if persistent; back up data first.
verification: Hardware works normally after following steps for several restarts/use.
log_snippet: Firmware: GPU Failure / Artifacts BIOS error at POST stage

user_error_text: Power Supply Problems (PSU) - battery/indicator issues noticed
symptoms: Random shutdowns, won't boot under load
cause: Failing PSU or power delivery issues
step_1: Check power cable and PSU switch.
step_2: Bypass surge protector/UPS to test.
step_3: Listen for unusual PSU noises; power down if present.
step_4: Test with known-good PSU (desktop) or seek repair.
step_5: Replace PSU with quality unit if failing.
verification: Hardware works normally after following steps for several restarts/use.
log_snippet: SMART: Power Supply Problems (PSU) reported reallocated sectors threshold exceeded

user_error_text: Power Supply Problems (PSU) - clicking noise or no boot
symptoms: Random shutdowns, won't boot under load
cause: Failing PSU or power delivery issues
step_1: Check power cable and PSU switch.
step_2: Bypass surge protector/UPS to test.
step_3: Listen for unusual PSU noises; power down if present.
step_4: Test with known-good PSU (desktop) or seek repair.
step_5: Replace PSU with quality unit if failing.
verification: Hardware works normally after following steps for several restarts/use.
log_snippet: Firmware: Power Supply Problems (PSU) BIOS error at POST stage

user_error_text: Motherboard BIOS/UEFI Issues when running heavy apps/games
symptoms: Boot errors, POST failures, settings reset
cause: Corrupted BIOS/UEFI or failed update
step_1: Power cycle and try loading BIOS defaults.

step_3: Avoid flashing BIOS without instructions.
step_4: Follow OEM recovery for dual-BIOS if available.
step_5: Contact manufacturer support if motherboard won't POST.

user_error_text: Laptop Battery Not Charging - clicking noise or no boot
symptoms: Laptop not charging or short battery life
cause: Aged battery or charging circuit fault
step_1: Try different compatible charger/adapter.
step_2: Remove battery (if possible) and power cycle.
step_3: Calibrate battery by full charge/discharge cycle.
step_4: Check battery health via manufacturer app.
step_5: Replace battery if health is poor.

user_error_text: Cooling Fan Failure detected after startup

step_1: Shut down and clear dust from vents.
step_2: Check fan spin on startup; replace if dead.

step_4: Reseat/replace fan for desktop or consult technician.
step_5: Avoid heavy use until cooling restored.

user_error_text: NIC / Ethernet Port Hardware Issue when running heavy apps/games
symptoms: Ethernet port no link, no network
cause: NIC hardware fault or cable/port issue
step_1: Try different Ethernet cable and router port.
step_2: Check link/activity LEDs on NIC and router.
step_3: Update NIC drivers or roll back recent updates.
step_4: Reseat NIC or try USB-to-Ethernet adapter.
step_5: Replace NIC or seek repair if port failed.
verification: Hardware works normally after following steps for several restarts/use.

user_error_text: NIC / Ethernet Port Hardware Issue when running heavy apps/games
symptoms: Ethernet port no link, no network
cause: NIC hardware fault or cable/port issue
step_1: Try different Ethernet cable and router port.
step_2: Check link/activity LEDs on NIC and router.
step_3: Update NIC drivers or roll back recent updates.
step_4: Reseat NIC or try USB-to-Ethernet adapter.
step_5: Replace NIC or seek repair if port failed.
verification: Hardware works normally after following steps for several restarts/use.
log_snippet: Firmware: NIC / Ethernet Port Hardware Issue BIOS error at POST stage
